statement:
If $$\begin{aligned}
\label{eq}
\frac{dy}{dx}&=&f(x,y)\end{aligned}$$ is an ordinary differential
equation where $f(x,y)$ is continuous on a planar domain $E$, then
(\[eq\]) has at least one integral curve for each $(x_0,y_0)$ of
$E$.[@KF; @T]

[1]{} , *Introductory Real Analysis, Translated & Edited by Richard A.
Silverman*, Dover Publications, Inc. New York, 1970. , ** , 2004.
